keqe_expansions: Bagels are round bread products with a dense and chewy texture. They are typically made from flour, water, yeast, salt, and sometimes sugar. Bagels are boiled before they are baked, which gives them their characteristic chewy exterior and soft interior. They can be topped with various ingredients such as sesame seeds, poppy seeds, or onions. Bagels are often sliced and toasted before being served with cream cheese, butter, or as a base for sandwiches. Overall, bagels are a popular breakfast or snack option enjoyed by many people around the world.

Bagels are a popular type of bread product that originated in Poland and are now enjoyed all over the world. These round bread rolls are typically made with wheat flour, yeast, salt, and water, then boiled and baked to achieve their signature chewy texture and crispy crust. Bagels can be enjoyed plain, with various toppings such as cream cheese, smoked salmon, or jam, making them a versatile and delicious snack or meal option. Whether you prefer a classic plain bagel or a more adventurous flavor like everything bagel seasoning, there is a bagel variety to suit every taste preference.
top_passages: Examination of the antiglycemic properties of vinegar in healthy adults.	BACKGROUND: Vinegar reduces postprandial glycemia (PPG) in healthy adults. This study investigated the vinegar dosage (10 vs. 20 g), timing (during mealtime vs. 5 h before meal) and application (acetic acid as vinegar vs. neutralized salt) for reducing PPG. METHODS: Four randomized crossover trials were conducted in adults (n = 9-10/trial) with type 2 diabetes (1 trial) or without diabetes (3 trials). All trials followed the same protocol: a standardized meal the evening prior to testing, an overnight fast ( 1 10 h) and 2-hour glucose testing
